inventory.commentary: No Verb Particle Constructions for this verb

sense.name: finish or end something
sense.examples: We concluded the meeting with coffee and dessert. They are just now concluding their performance of Aida. This concludes our nightly broadcast. Boeing has concluded a series of wind tunnel tests on a modified 747.

sense.name: resolve or agree upon
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CONCLUDE NP2[goal[abstract]] NOTE: this does NOT mean for two or more people to agree on something reasoned or deduced, as in, "They concluded that the drug was safe and effective." Such examples should be in sense 3.
sense.examples: After weeks of negotiation the governments have concluded a viable trade agreement. We were unable to conclude a good deal for our firm's IPO. The two firms concluded a strategic alliance. We have concluded a covenant with death. Submit your notification immediately after you have concluded a guarantee agreement.

sense.name: reason or deduce
sense.examples: Given 'if P then Q' and 'P', must you conclude 'Q'? The police concluded John committed the murder, based on DNA evidence. On what basis did the ancients conclude that the sun revolved around the earth? Mary is concluding that John is a boor, based on his table manners.

sense.name: say (used as a quotative)
sense.examples: "The negative use of taxing authority is poor public policy," the report concluded. "You put your foot out in that street and you'll be arrested," he concluded. "Married people can specialize," she concluded.
